prompt.prompt: More than 80% of the states in the US have populations under 10 million. A few states, like Texas and California, have populations greater than 25 million. A histogram displaying state population data will be:

The two histograms below represent the amount of money spent on a pair of jeans, one for a sample of sixth grade students (left) and one for a sample of eighth grade students (right). All amounts in the dataset are represented as whole numbers rounded to the nearest dollar.  

 ![](./jeans-cost-6th.png) ![](./jeans-cost-8th.png)
distractors: the modes are roughly the same

prompt.prompt: The histogram below shows the Verbal SAT scores for 205 students entering a local college in the fall of 2002. The median score for these 205 students is: ![](./sat-verbal.png)

The Towson Tennis association has three senior tennis leagues (Monday League, Tuesday League, and Wednesday League). The following histograms show the distribution of ages of players in each league. Identify the league whose players have the least variability in ages. 

 ![](./tennis-leagues.png)
distractors: Impossible to tell from the given information
